definition: to pull/to play (a bowed instrument)/to drag/to draw/to chat

sentences.english: Beral thinks a more interesting candidate for study is prolactin .
sentences.chinese: 贝拉尔认为，一个更为有趣的研究课题是泌乳刺激素。

sentences.english: Both Vela and Dos Santos are currently preparing to star for Mexico in the World Cup finals.
sentences.chinese: 贝拉和多斯最近正在为世界杯努力着。

sentences.english: The Bellagio in Las Vegas has even more to offer.
sentences.chinese: 在拉斯维加斯贝拉吉欧更提供。

sentences.english: Rick chinned the helmet stud again and told Bela to make it quick.
sentences.chinese: 瑞克连通头盔话筒，告诉贝拉动作要快。

sentences.english: With Isabella dying, Edgar travels to London to pick up Linton.
sentences.chinese: 伊莎贝拉死后，埃德加去伦敦接回了小林顿。

sentences.english: However, 19 year-old Beira actually soberly saw the brutal reality.
sentences.chinese: 不过，19岁的贝拉却清醒地看到了残酷的现实。

sentences.english: It's ten years since Arabella left me.
sentences.chinese: 阿里贝拉离开我有十年了。

sentences.english: Q. I was wondering if Bella had any other interests besides Edward?
sentences.chinese: 我想知道贝拉除了爱德华之外有没有其他兴趣呢？

sentences.english: "I call it a spa for yarn, " explains Mr.
sentences.chinese: “我叫它‘纱之温泉’”巴贝拉解释道。

sentences.english: Redknapp himself would not be drawn on the Bellamy deal last night.
sentences.chinese: 雷德克纳普昨晚则承认则尚未确认贝拉米的交易。

sentences.english: Aunt Isabella had not you and me to nurse her,' I replied.
sentences.chinese: “伊莎贝拉姑姑没有你和我来照应她，”我回答。

sentences.english: And Bale died, and Jobab the son of Zare of Bosra, reigned in his stead.
sentences.chinese: 贝拉死后，波责辣人则辣黑的儿子约巴布继他为王。

sentences.english: Bela the son of Beor, and the name of his city Denaba.
sentences.chinese: 贝敖尔的儿子贝拉在厄东作王，他的京城名叫丁哈巴。

sentences.english: Thvia's why Bella can'tgo on a hunting trip with him.
sentences.chinese: 这就是为什么他不能带上贝拉一起去狩猎远足的因由。

sentences.english: This is Kahneman's Nobel lecture. See a video of it.
sentences.chinese: 这是卡尼曼获得诺贝拉奖时的演讲，参见影片。

sentences.english: The video of Arabella's recitation has gone viral on the Chinese social media.
sentences.chinese: 阿拉贝拉背诵唐诗的视频在中国社交媒体上走红。

definition: Michel or Mitchell (name)/George Mitchell (1933-), US Democratic party politician and diplomat, influential in brokering Northern Ireland peace deal in 1990s, US Middle East special envoy from 2009
Kara, city in northern Togo 多哥[Duo1 ge1]/Cara, Karla etc (name)
